name: Four Seasons Hotel Vancouver

reviews.text: Nice hotel, but what did I do to get stuck with the room that faced a construction site? I didn't notice this right away because the drapes were drawn when I entered the room after checking in. It was night when I opened them and didn't notice the construction site until 7am when the noise started. I could see them and they were close enough to see me...not comfortable! I wanted to wake up in the morning to the sites of the city and skyscapers, not a construction site. It was a pretty disappointing way to start my new life in vancouver. My company put me up in this hotel during my relocation. I had a early morning flight the day before with only a few hours of sleep...being woken up @ 7am to the noise of construction was not the way I wanted to start my day. Needless to say, I was not impressed. Just make sure you to ask that you have a room that does not face the construction. I don't plan to stay at a four seasons ever again.
reviews.title: I love having a view of construction workers when I wake up....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the night of my wedding night I booked at the Four Seasons for the night. When I got there in my suit and the wife in hers we were immediately upgraded to a suite and given 2 free breakfasts worth $85 and not to mention free parking!!! Everything they did for us was greatly appreciated and I will be there again for sure....
reviews.title: They Hooked us up!!

reviews.text: LOCATION: Easy access to and from airport and other locations. Subway right across street. If not renting a car ( which i suggest not to bec. you can go anywhere with subway or bus easily) its just one train to front of hotel from airport. Connected to mall is great especially when it rains. Can access mall before opening hours and it helped us because our 3 yr old needed to run and be entertained. Food court in mall also a plus along with food court of The Bay. London Drugs (convenience store) right across street and can access by never going out if you use mall entrance. Robson street for shopping is one block away. HOTEL: Clean and what to expect from 4 seasons. But hotel rooms a bit smaller than expected. Everything worked and no complaints. POOL: Average size and heated. Half the pool is indoors and the other is outdoors. Which was nice because we went in December 2009 and our daughter loved going outside and looking at the steam. Overall pool, jacuzzi and gym is fair. Remember its not a resort and in the heart of the city. FOOD: We tried the YEW restaurant and it was nice. We thought it was better than leaving hotel. Kids 5 and under eat free and they cater to the kids very well (the quantity is easily for a 5 year old). We aren’t too picky with food so cant give a good comment on taste but we liked it.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for my wife's birthday. Very trendy and modern feel to this four seasons - it goes well with the style of the city. We had a room (I forget what floor) with an unreal view of the bay and subsequent skyline. It is on top of a shopping plaza that is connected to the subway. Everything is within walking distance and as always, the Four Seasons experience and level of service did not disappoint. I would recommend the restaurant "Gotham", which is around the block. Fantastic wine selection, great steaks and the atmosphere was A+. This was a top recommendation from the concierge, which also set us up with a helicopter tour over to Vancouver Island. Great Hotel, great service and a wonderful city to visit. . . . at least in the summer!
reviews.title: Classy, Hip Hotel with excellent views and in the center of town
Nice Hotel with great service
reviews.text: Central location - excellent service. Nice rooms. Friendly staff. I would book this hotel again.

We stayed here with extended family after Christmas through New Year's. I'm sure there are fancier hotels in Vancouver but none that is more comfortable than this Four Seasons. We had two rooms for our family of five and they were connected by a little private entryway that allowed us to leave our doors open and move between rooms freely. Very nice. The bathrooms and rooms were extremely clean and adequately spacious. Nicely decorated with city views. The maid service was outstanding as was the room service which we ordered the night before for 5 am so we could go to Whistler for the day. The food was on time, hot and delicious.
reviews.title: Lots to love

reviews.text: In the lobby there was an extremely helpful concierge that made restaurant recommendations and reservations as well as reservations for ski school in Whistler. Directions and maps provided for every trip and destination. Super nice. Also the hotel has a great area for kids off the lobby with video games and tables for coloring and board games. It's like a library in a castle, really big and beautiful. For adults and kids the gym/pool rooms are clean and well stocked with towels, headsets and a selection of fruit infused waters to refresh yourself with. It was December and we were able to swim in the indoor/outdoor pool with no problem. And the hot tub and sauana were really hot, the way they are supposed to be.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Will be back
FOUR seasons
reviews.text: The hotel is situated in the middle of downtown, surrounded by shops and restaurants, on top of a very nice mall and close to the art museum, We all had a great time at this hotel, there was something to love for everyone from the littlest kid, 7 yrs old to teenagers to grandparents.
Was here for 3 nights on a business trip.
reviews.title: excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in the heart of the Vancouver business district. The hotel itself is a little older although the rooms have been refurbished recently. Room amenities are top notch and the bed was very comfortable. Turndown service every evening was great. The lobby area and resteraunt are very nice and well designed.
reviews.title: Great Four Seasons Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good:
reviews.title: Location, location, location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Awesome central location, right on top of a mall, makes for easy shopping and cheap food. It's also within walking distance from other commercial streets, such as Granville, and Robson Street.
reviews.title: excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Rooms we clean and roomy. Cleaning crew was awesome.
reviews.title: thumbs up!!

reviews.text: - The bed was one of the best I've had in a hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in a Fabulous city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Indoor/outdoor swimming pool, with nice hot tub. There are but a few things better than taking a leisurely swim after a long day of shopping, while looking up to the the people stuck working late in office buildings. Service at the pool/gym was great.
reviews.title: Luxury Hotel

reviews.text: Thumbs Up:
reviews.title: Excellent hotel - great location, impeccable service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -great location - close to Robson Street where all the nice restaurants and shops are
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: -the check in was fast and the staff was extremely freindly and efficient
reviews.title: Great Location, Medicore Otherwise

reviews.text: -even the bellman and the parking lot staff are extremely friendly and courteous - rather rare even for a 5 star hotel
reviews.title: Luxury

reviews.text: -the room was clean and spacious
reviews.title: Always a Pleasure to Stay

description: Rising above Pacific Centre, Four Seasons Hotel Vancouver presents 30 storeys of relaxed urban luxury and thoughtful, experienced care. The natural charms and cosmopolitan airs of downtown Vancouver inform our luxury hotel’s inviting atmosphere.
